label: obj-algorithmic-space-generic
name: Algorithmic Space
definition: A pair consisting of a real vector space Y and a metric d_Y, where agents are projected to for comparison. It is the abstract space where distances and diversity are measured, distinct from the primary state space X where dynamics occur.
mathematical_properties: The space is assumed to be a Polish space (complete, separable metric space) and to have a finite diameter, D_Y. This ensures that Wasserstein metrics are well-posed and that all per-walker displacements are bounded.

typical_values.Y: Typically a bounded subset of a finite-dimensional Euclidean space, R^m.
